Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Pastor Lawrence Aker, Cornerstone Baptist Church, 289 Lewis Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11221.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cornegy.

The Invocation was delivered by  Pastor Lawrence Aker, Cornerstone Baptist Church, 289 Lewis Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11211.



Council Member Cornegy moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Van Bramer moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 9, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Johnson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 289 Bleecker Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 2, Application No. 20165357 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 289 Bleecker St, Manhattan (20165357 TCM)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Supreme Court to issue a decision in United States v. Texas that overturns the Fifth Circuit’s ruling in Texas v. United States, and upholds the implementation of President Obama’s expanded DACA and DAPA programs.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Members formally voted against this item:  Council Members Borelli, Matteo and Ulrich.


The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item:  Council Member Gentile.  


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: US Supreme Court to issue a decision in United States v. Texas that overturns the Fifth Circuit’s ruling in Texas v. United States, and upholds the implementation of President Obama’s expanded DACA and DAPA programs.

Items.MatterName: Evaluation of civil actions alleging improper conduct by correction officers.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Creating a commission on gender equity.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Neighborhood support teams.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress and the President to oppose H.R.923/S.498, known as the “Constitutional Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act of 2015,” and related bill H.R.402, known as the “National Right-to-Carry Reciprocity Act of 2015,” which would allow a resident from one state who has a license to carry a concealed handgun to lawfully carry his or her handgun in a different state, regardless of the licensing eligibility standards in the other state.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Oppose the Constitutional Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act of 2015 (H.R.923/S.498)  and the National Right-to-Carry Reciprocity Act of 2015 (H.R.402)

Items.Title: A Local Law to establish a task force on affordability, admissions, and graduation rates at the City University of New York
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Establish a task force on affordability, admissions, and graduation rates at CUNY.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Allowing restaurant surcharges.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting smoking and using electronic cigarettes in vehicles when a child under the age of eight is present, and to repeal subdivision f of section 17-505
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting smoking and using electronic cigarettes in vehicles when a child under the age of eight is present.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign a law amending article 45 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules to prohibit juvenile admissions and statements against penal interest made during court-ordered mental health screening and treatment from being admitted into evidence in subsequent criminal proceedings
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Juvenile Justice
Items.MatterName: Prohibit juvenile admissions and statements against penal interest made during court-ordered mental health screening and treatment from being admitted into evidence in subsequent criminal proceedings.

Items.MatterName: The certification or training of teachers, administrators and instructors in the area of dyslexia and related disorders. (A.1480/S.2534)

Items.MatterName: DOE to have a full time mental health counselor on staff at every elementary and middle school.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation amending Article 7-B of the Multiple Dwelling Law to expand the definition of an “artist” for the purpose of qualifying for certain joint living-work quarters.

Items.MatterName: Amending Article 7-B of the Multiple Dwelling Law to expand the definition of an “artist” for the purpose of qualifying for certain joint living-work quarters.
